entry.title: one-show signatures (Re: The relationship between Proof-of-Publication and Anti-Replay Oracles)
entry.summary: In an email thread, Adam Back suggested that it is possible to define a new rule where two signatures authorize something and miners can take funds. However, Peter Todd argues that clever math isn't what prevents double-spending, but rather clever economics, just like Bitcoin itself. He believes that presenting complex equations could potentially confuse people and obscure the more fundamental principle that math alone cannot prevent double-spending.
